title: Altar farming
data:
In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, **altar farming**, sometimes referred to as **altar scumming** in more extreme forms, is the act of camping by an [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") within the [Mazes of Menace](/wiki/Mazes_of_Menace "Mazes of Menace") for an inordinate amount of time for the purpose of obtaining numerous [sacrifice gifts](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift") and [favors](/wiki/Favor "Favor"). As with some other forms of [farming](/wiki/Farming "Farming"), some players may consider this to be against the spirit of the game.

## Description

[Monster creation](/wiki/Monster_creation "Monster creation") does happen over time, but normally not fast enough for the purposes of altar farming. Players who want to try altar farming will usually need a way to spawn a large number of strong monsters very quickly. Useful tools for accomplishing this include:

- Being on a lower [dungeon level](/wiki/Dungeon_level "Dungeon level") or having a higher [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") (makes stronger monsters spawn)
- Using [wands](/wiki/Wand_of_create_monster "Wand of create monster") or [scrolls of create monster](/wiki/Scroll_of_create_monster "Scroll of create monster"), the [spell of create monster](/wiki/Spell_of_create_monster "Spell of create monster"), or a [bag of tricks](/wiki/Bag_of_tricks "Bag of tricks") to manually create monsters.
  - [Scrolls of charging](/wiki/Scrolls_of_charging "Scrolls of charging") and [The Platinum Yendorian Express Card](/wiki/The_Platinum_Yendorian_Express_Card "The Platinum Yendorian Express Card") increase the uses available from the wand and bag, and [The Eye of the Aethiopica](/wiki/The_Eye_of_the_Aethiopica "The Eye of the Aethiopica") or [The Mitre of Holiness](/wiki/The_Mitre_of_Holiness "The Mitre of Holiness") allow the spell to be cast frequently
- Having a [werecreature](/wiki/Werecreature "Werecreature") summon help or a spellcasting monster cast the [summon nasties](/wiki/Summon_nasties "Summon nasties") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell")
- Being [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic") (allows for [same-race sacrifices](/wiki/Sacrifice#Sacrificing_creatures_of_own_race "Sacrifice"))

Of course, just because you can create an extremely high number of monsters doesn't mean you'll live to sacrifice them all - various monsters that are either horrifically strong or else capable of instantly killing you must dealt with promptly. Other tools must also be on hand to manage all their [death drops](/wiki/Death_drop "Death drop"):

- Low [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") to take numerous strong physical attacks
- A strong [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") to kill monsters quickly
  - Sacrificing can give you an [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") to use for further farming
- [Gloves](/wiki/Gloves "Gloves") to handle [cockatrice corpses](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice")
- [Magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") to resist the [destroy armor](/wiki/Destroy_armor_\(monster_spell\) "Destroy armor (monster spell)") and [curse items](/wiki/Curse_items "Curse items") monster spells
- [Reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") to resist [attack wands](/wiki/Attack_wand "Attack wand") and [dragon](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon") [breath](/wiki/Breath "Breath")
- [Escape items](/wiki/Escape_item "Escape item") if too many monsters spawn or the ones spawned are too much to handle
- A [container](/wiki/Container "Container") for storing useful death drops and keeping them out of monsters’ hands
- Means of curing [lycanthropy](/wiki/Lycanthropy "Lycanthropy") if using werecreatures for farming
- Plenty of [food](/wiki/Food "Food") or a [ring of slow digestion](/wiki/Ring_of_slow_digestion "Ring of slow digestion") if you’re following a food-related [conduct](/wiki/Conduct#Vegan "Conduct")
  - Food also helps save corpses for sacrificing that you’d otherwise have to eat (unless you want their [intrinsics](/wiki/Corpse#Gaining_intrinsics "Corpse"))

## Sacrificing for gifts

One of the benefits that can be gained from altar farming is [sacrifice gifts](/wiki/Sacrifice#Gifts "Sacrifice"); with the extremely high number of sacrifices coming in, [artifact weapons](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") are much easier to come across, and you can get multiple in case you don’t get the one you want. Of course, the more gifts you receive, the longer it’ll take for you to get your next one. [Grayswandir](/wiki/Grayswandir "Grayswandir"), [Vorpal Blade](/wiki/Vorpal_Blade "Vorpal Blade"), [Magicbane](/wiki/Magicbane "Magicbane"), [Fire Brand](/wiki/Fire_Brand "Fire Brand"), [Frost Brand](/wiki/Frost_Brand "Frost Brand"), and [Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer "Stormbringer") are all in reasonable reach with the use of altar farming.

## Sacrificing to pray

The other benefit of altar farming is that it can very quickly lower your [prayer timeout](/wiki/Prayer_timeout "Prayer timeout") so you can repeatedly pray for [gifts, favors, and other boons](/wiki/Prayer#Favors_and_gifts "Prayer"). The ones that are the most worth pursuing include:

- Removing [curses](/wiki/Curses "Curses") without spending [holy water](/wiki/Holy_water "Holy water")
- Increasing your max HP (by bringing yourself to low HP before praying)
- Gaining intrinsic [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy"), [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed"), [stealth](/wiki/Stealth "Stealth") and [intrinsic protection](/wiki/Intrinsic_protection "Intrinsic protection")
- Obtaining [spellbooks](/wiki/Spellbooks "Spellbooks") (you’ll usually get ones in schools you’re not restricted in)

Staying at a high enough level of [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") for the best outcomes usually involves carrying around a [luckstone](/wiki/Luckstone "Luckstone"), but be careful! If your luck’s too high, there’s a chance you’ll get [crowned](/wiki/Crowned "Crowned") instead, greatly slowing down the rate at which you can pray. Once you're at max luck, you can avoid crowning by breaking a [mirror](/wiki/Mirror "Mirror") and putting away your luckstone before praying. You can also prevent crowning (even with maximum luck) by ensuring that your [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") is below 20 when you pray. You can accomplish this by [misusing an altar](/wiki/Altar#Misusing_an_altar "Altar"), and check your alignment record with a [stethoscope](/wiki/Stethoscope "Stethoscope"), [wand of probing](/wiki/Wand_of_probing "Wand of probing"), or [enlightenment](/wiki/Enlightenment "Enlightenment") on yourself and ensuring that you are not piously aligned.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Altar farming

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

In NetHack, altar farming, sometimes referred to as altar scumming in more extreme forms, is the act of camping by an altar within the Mazes of Menace for an inordinate amount of time for the purpose of obtaining numerous sacrifice gifts and favors. As with some other forms of farming, some players may consider this to be against the spirit of the game.

Description

Monster creation does happen over time, but normally not fast enough for the purposes of altar farming. Players who want to try altar farming will usually need a way to spawn a large number of strong monsters very quickly. Useful tools for accomplishing this include:

  • Being on a lower dungeon level or having a higher experience level (makes stronger monsters spawn)
  • Using wands or scrolls of create monster, the spell of create monster, or a bag of tricks to manually create monsters.
    • Scrolls of charging and The Platinum Yendorian Express Card increase the uses available from the wand and bag, and The Eye of the Aethiopica or The Mitre of Holiness allow the spell to be cast frequently
  • Having a werecreature summon help or a spellcasting monster cast the summon nasties monster spell
  • Being chaotic (allows for same-race sacrifices)

Of course, just because you can create an extremely high number of monsters doesn't mean you'll live to sacrifice them all - various monsters that are either horrifically strong or else capable of instantly killing you must dealt with promptly. Other tools must also be on hand to manage all their death drops:

  • Low AC to take numerous strong physical attacks
  • A strong weapon to kill monsters quickly
    • Sacrificing can give you an artifact weapon to use for further farming
  • Gloves to handle cockatrice corpses
  • Magic resistance to resist the destroy armor and curse items monster spells
  • Reflection to resist attack wands and dragon breath
  • Escape items if too many monsters spawn or the ones spawned are too much to handle
  • A container for storing useful death drops and keeping them out of monsters’ hands
  • Means of curing lycanthropy if using werecreatures for farming
  • Plenty of food or a ring of slow digestion if you’re following a food-related conduct
    • Food also helps save corpses for sacrificing that you’d otherwise have to eat (unless you want their intrinsics)

Sacrificing for gifts

One of the benefits that can be gained from altar farming is sacrifice gifts; with the extremely high number of sacrifices coming in, artifact weapons are much easier to come across, and you can get multiple in case you don’t get the one you want. Of course, the more gifts you receive, the longer it’ll take for you to get your next one. Grayswandir, Vorpal Blade, Magicbane, Fire Brand, Frost Brand, and Stormbringer are all in reasonable reach with the use of altar farming.

Sacrificing to pray

The other benefit of altar farming is that it can very quickly lower your prayer timeout so you can repeatedly pray for gifts, favors, and other boons. The ones that are the most worth pursuing include:

  • Removing curses without spending holy water
  • Increasing your max HP (by bringing yourself to low HP before praying)
  • Gaining intrinsic telepathy, speed, stealth and intrinsic protection
  • Obtaining spellbooks (you’ll usually get ones in schools you’re not restricted in)

Staying at a high enough level of luck for the best outcomes usually involves carrying around a luckstone, but be careful! If your luck’s too high, there’s a chance you’ll get crowned instead, greatly slowing down the rate at which you can pray. Once you're at max luck, you can avoid crowning by breaking a mirror and putting away your luckstone before praying. You can also prevent crowning (even with maximum luck) by ensuring that your alignment record is below 20 when you pray. You can accomplish this by misusing an altar, and check your alignment record with a stethoscope, wand of probing, or enlightenment on yourself and ensuring that you are not piously aligned.
